buildingblocks.name: Educational Access
buildingblocks.summary: Educational access is about making resources available to students, and the academic insttutions they attend. Academic pricing allows students to put resources to work, gain a familiarity with services, without having to pay regular fees.
buildingblocks.details: Educational access is about making resources available to students, and the academic insttutions they attend. Academic pricing allows students to put resources to work, gain a familiarity with services, without having to pay regular fees.

buildingblocks.name: Send Message
buildingblocks.summary: Providing the ablity to send SMS to any mobile number via the API.
buildingblocks.details: Providing the ablity to send SMS to any mobile number via the API.

buildingblocks.name: Receive Message
buildingblocks.summary: Providing the ability to receive SMS messages from any source.
buildingblocks.details: Providing the ability to receive SMS messages from any source.

buildingblocks.name: Search Messages
buildingblocks.summary: Provide the abilty to search SMS messages sent and received via the API.
buildingblocks.details: Provide the abilty to search SMS messages sent and received via the API.

buildingblocks.name: List Messages
buildingblocks.summary: Provide a listing of SMS messages sent and received via the API.
buildingblocks.details: Provide a listing of SMS messages sent and received via the API.

buildingblocks.name: Free
buildingblocks.summary: A popular way to provide access to an API, is by offering a free tier so that anyone can sign up, start using an API and understand the value an API delivers. This allows consumers to kick the tires, see if it will meet their needs before spending money.
buildingblocks.details: A popular way to provide access to an API, is by offering a free tier so that anyone can sign up, start using an API and understand the value an API delivers. This allows consumers to kick the tires, see if it will meet their needs before spending money.

buildingblocks.name: Free Trial
buildingblocks.summary: Rather than just free for an unknown amount of time, so API providers are providing the ability to test drive an API for a period of time, then you have to pay. Usually this is associated with some sort of SaaS business model.
buildingblocks.details: Rather than just free for an unknown amount of time, so API providers are providing the ability to test drive an API for a period of time, then you have to pay. Usually this is associated with some sort of SaaS business model.

buildingblocks.name: Freemium
buildingblocks.summary: Providing a relief for free users, allowing them to upgrade to a paid account, usuallky part of a tiered approach to pricing. Freemium starts as free, allowing users to kick the tires, but once they begin to depend on they can begin paying for the service.
buildingblocks.details: Providing a relief for free users, allowing them to upgrade to a paid account, usuallky part of a tiered approach to pricing. Freemium starts as free, allowing users to kick the tires, but once they begin to depend on they can begin paying for the service.

buildingblocks.name: Not For Profit
buildingblocks.summary: It is not just Sillicon Valley startups doing APIs, non-profit organizations, and government agencies are doing APIs, and the monetization strategy is not all about making money.
buildingblocks.details: It is not just Sillicon Valley startups doing APIs, non-profit organizations, and government agencies are doing APIs, and the monetization strategy is not all about making money.

buildingblocks.name: Request Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Services that require a user pays, but does not have pricing listed directly on the site, and users must request a quote for pricing on single or all API access.
buildingblocks.details: Services that require a user pays, but does not have pricing listed directly on the site, and users must request a quote for pricing on single or all API access.

buildingblocks.name: Buy Credits
buildingblocks.summary: You haveh to buy credits, charge your user accounts with funds from PayPal, bank account, or credit card before you can exceed basic API rate limits.
buildingblocks.details: You haveh to buy credits, charge your user accounts with funds from PayPal, bank account, or credit card before you can exceed basic API rate limits.

buildingblocks.name: Volume Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Providing additional layers of pricing based upon volume purchases, allowing users to better understand their API usage and potentially buy in bulk based upon their past habits.
buildingblocks.details: Providing additional layers of pricing based upon volume purchases, allowing users to better understand their API usage and potentially buy in bulk based upon their past habits.

buildingblocks.name: Lists / Groups
buildingblocks.summary: Provide the ability to manage lists of users, and send messages to these lists or groups.
buildingblocks.details: Provide the ability to manage lists of users, and send messages to these lists or groups.

buildingblocks.name: Keywords / Tags
buildingblocks.summary: Provide the ability to manage keywords or tags and associate with SMS messages or the users who message are sent to or received from.
buildingblocks.details: Provide the ability to manage keywords or tags and associate with SMS messages or the users who message are sent to or received from.

buildingblocks.name: Pay as You Go
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing API consumer to pay as they go, accumulating a monthly bill, or possibly prepaying on their account. Either way they are able to pay for what they us of API resources, as they use it.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing API consumer to pay as they go, accumulating a monthly bill, or possibly prepaying on their account. Either way they are able to pay for what they us of API resources, as they use it.

buildingblocks.name: Tiered
buildingblocks.summary: Providing multiple tiers of paid access, such as bronze, gold or platinum. Each tier has its own set or services and allowances for access to API resources. With pricing, stepping up in cost for each tier
buildingblocks.details: Providing multiple tiers of paid access, such as bronze, gold or platinum. Each tier has its own set or services and allowances for access to API resources. With pricing, stepping up in cost for each tier

buildingblocks.name: Unit Based
buildingblocks.summary: When pricing is based upon individually define units of value made available via an API. This could be per API call, storage on disk, message, or any other pre-defined unit of measurement.
buildingblocks.details: When pricing is based upon individually define units of value made available via an API. This could be per API call, storage on disk, message, or any other pre-defined unit of measurement.

buildingblocks.name: Enterprise Pricing
buildingblocks.summary: Enterprise is a broad term to describe pricing that is part of a larger sales process, and a common way for large companies to price products and services based upon a customers need, and information extracted through sales cycles.
buildingblocks.details: Enterprise is a broad term to describe pricing that is part of a larger sales process, and a common way for large companies to price products and services based upon a customers need, and information extracted through sales cycles.

buildingblocks.name: Delivery Receipts
buildingblocks.summary: The ability to receive confirmatons of delivery for SMS messages sent.
buildingblocks.details: The ability to receive confirmatons of delivery for SMS messages sent.

buildingblocks.name: Number Validation
buildingblocks.summary: Allowoing API users to validate phone numbers they are going to send SMS messages to, making sure they can receive SMS messages.
buildingblocks.details: Allowoing API users to validate phone numbers they are going to send SMS messages to, making sure they can receive SMS messages.

buildingblocks.name: Scheduling
buildingblocks.summary: Allow messages to be schedule and put into a queue, only sending messages when their schedule time has rolled over.
buildingblocks.details: Allow messages to be schedule and put into a queue, only sending messages when their schedule time has rolled over.

buildingblocks.name: Short Codes
buildingblocks.summary: Providing short codes for the delivery of messages, allowing simple messages to be delivered via a single number codes.
buildingblocks.details: Providing short codes for the delivery of messages, allowing simple messages to be delivered via a single number codes.

buildingblocks.name: Account Balance
buildingblocks.summary: Allow API access to check the balance of account to see where the budget is for sending or receiving of messages.
buildingblocks.details: Allow API access to check the balance of account to see where the budget is for sending or receiving of messages.

buildingblocks.name: Quota
buildingblocks.summary: Allowng API access for checking account quota to see how may messages have been sent or received.
buildingblocks.details: Allowng API access for checking account quota to see how may messages have been sent or received.

buildingblocks.name: Prices
buildingblocks.summary: Allowing users to check the price for sending messages via the API and receive specific or all of the prices for messaging.
buildingblocks.details: Allowing users to check the price for sending messages via the API and receive specific or all of the prices for messaging.

buildingblocks.name: Marketing Vehicle
buildingblocks.summary: APIs can provide an excellent marketing vehicle for a company and its online presence. Through sensible branding strategies, developers can become 3rd party marketing agents, working on behalf of a core company and its b
buildingblocks.details: APIs can provide an excellent marketing vehicle for a company and its online presence. Through sensible branding strategies, developers can become 3rd party marketing agents, working on behalf of a core company and its b

buildingblocks.name: Traffic Generation
buildingblocks.summary: APIs can also be used to drive traffic to an existing website or applicaiton. By desigining an API to use hyperlinks directed at central websites or apps, and encouraging consumers to build their own websites and apps that are integrated with the API, the opportunity for driving traffic to other sites is very desireable to many companies who are providing APIs.
buildingblocks.details: APIs can also be used to drive traffic to an existing website or applicaiton. By desigining an API to use hyperlinks directed at central websites or apps, and encouraging consumers to build their own websites and apps that are integrated with the API, the opportunity for driving traffic to other sites is very desireable to many companies who are providing APIs.

buildingblocks.name: Brand Awareness
buildingblocks.summary: As a new tool in an overall marketing and branding strategy, an API can provide a type type of brand exposure via 3rd party websites and applications. Extending the reach of a brand, using 3rd party API consumers as the engine.
buildingblocks.details: As a new tool in an overall marketing and branding strategy, an API can provide a type type of brand exposure via 3rd party websites and applications. Extending the reach of a brand, using 3rd party API consumers as the engine.

buildingblocks.name: Content Acquisition
buildingblocks.summary: Content acquisition is when a platform uses APIs to enable the adding, updating, and deleting of content for the purpose of employing users to generate content for a core platform.
buildingblocks.details: Content acquisition is when a platform uses APIs to enable the adding, updating, and deleting of content for the purpose of employing users to generate content for a core platform.

buildingblocks.name: SaaS
buildingblocks.summary: Software as a Service (SaaS) has become a common approach to selling software online to consumers and businesses. Often times an API will compliment the core software and its offering, providing value to SaaS users. API access is often included as part of core SaaS platform, but also can be delivered as an upsell for premium SaaS users.
buildingblocks.details: Software as a Service (SaaS) has become a common approach to selling software online to consumers and businesses. Often times an API will compliment the core software and its offering, providing value to SaaS users. API access is often included as part of core SaaS platform, but also can be delivered as an upsell for premium SaaS users.
